content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```

This function firstly converts the input string to lower case, then strips any leading or trailing whitespaces. After that, it replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[ -]"` matches either a space or a hyphen.
